title: Thyssenkrupp supervisory board to discuss Tata Steel JV - source
text:
March 28, 2018 / 3:02 PM / Updated 36 minutes ago Thyssenkrupp supervisory board to discuss Tata Steel JV - source Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
DUESSELDORF (Reuters) - Thyssenkrupp’s supervisory board will discuss a planned European steel joint venture with Tata Steel at an extraordinary meeting on April 12, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters. FILE PHOTO: Flags with the new logo of ThyssenKrupp flutter in the wind outside the headquarters of the German steel maker and multinational conglomerate in Essen, Germany, April 27, 2016. REUTERS/Wolfgang Rattay /File Photo 
The planned joint venture, which was originally due to be signed early in 2018, has faced renewed criticism after German union IG Metall threatened to withdraw its approval over the legal structure of the entity’s Dutch operations. Reporting by Tom Kaeckenhoff; Writing by Christoph Steitz; Editing by Maria Sheahan
